#Text=Pawleys Island
#Text=Pawleys Island is a city and barrier island in the Grand Strand region of South Carolina 's northern coast .
#Text=Get in
#Text=If you are traveling by air , you will want to fly into the Myrtle Beach International Airport ( MYR ) .
#Text=Regional carrier Spirit airlines runs regular routes from major airports , New York , Detroit , Atlantic City , etc.
#Text=Other carriers include American , Delta , and United .
#Text=Alternate airport is Charleston , SC about 90 miles South .
#Text=Heading South on Highway 17 the trip from the Myrtle Beach airport is about 45 minutes when the traffic flow is not heavy .
#Text=Highway 31 has a South bound expressway that creates greater access and easier traffic flow .
#Text=Get around
#Text=If you 're not driving to the island , you 'll want to rent a car .

#Text=There are no stores or restaurants on the island , and while the highly ambitious could walk or bike to the stores on the mainland , it 's a long way and the entire trip is on the highway as there are no bike paths or sidewalks .
#Text=You will be able to walk to the beach from everywhere on the island .
#Text=See
#Text=All Saints Church cemetery .
#Text=This cemetery features the graves of the poet James Dickey and the mysterious " Alice . "
#Text=Do

#Text=Pawleys Island is probably best described as a family vacation destination , and it 's most famous for its relaxed atmosphere -- other than the Sea View Inn and the Pelican Bed and Breakfast , there are no businesses on the island .
#Text=The main thing to do , of course , is hang out on the beach .
#Text=Because of limited public parking , the beaches are not too crowded , and the type of sand and the shape of the beach make for a good beach experience .
#Text=Surfing at Pawleys is somewhat popular , but South Carolina is not a surfing destination , and Pawleys is not the best surfing destination in South Carolina .
#Text=However , there are good waves , and you can have a great time on a body board .
#Text=Depending on the time of year , you can also catch some fish off the beach .
#Text=Pawleys Creek , behind the island , also offers a lot to do .
#Text=Fishing in the creek can be decent , and if you 're fishing from the shore or a dock , you do not need a fishing license .
#Text=If you do not have access to a dock , you can fish in the creek from one of the two causeway bridges , near one of the two boat landings , or at the extreme north or south ends of the island .
#Text=You can also get a small boats ( skiffs ) in the creek , though at low tide , the water gets pretty shallow in some spots .
#Text=Those who fish from boats usually troll for flounder .
#Text=Fish to be caught include flounder , red fish ( a/k/a red drum , spot tail bass ) , speckled trout , black drum , and blue fish .

#Text=Fishing bait and tackle is available at the Pawleys Island Hardware Store at the corner of North Causeway Rd . and US Hwy . 17 or at Pawleys Island Outdoors just north of the South Causeway on Hwy 17 .
#Text=Crabbing is also a popular past-time in the creek , and the crabbing is almost always good .
#Text=You can get a hand line and dip net or a ring net at the aforementioned bait stores and entertain the kids with an afternoon of crabbing .
#Text=If you want to catch some serious crabs , you can leave a crab pot soaking overnight .
#Text=While there are numerous clams and oysters in the creek , it is illegal to remove shell fish from the creek .
#Text=The creek is also a popular kayaking and paddle-boarding venue , and an internet search will provide you with plenty of choices for rentals .
#Text=If you 're in for a more relaxing time on the creek , a lot of folks get rafts or innertubes and just float down ( or up ) the creek with the tide .
#Text=There is a great deal to do off-island .

#Text=The Grand Strand ( the name for the string of South Carolina beaches from North Myrtle Beach in the north to just south of Pawleys Island ) has numerous ( perhaps a hundred ) golf courses , all types of restaurants , amusement parks , water parks and museums .
#Text=You can charter fishing trips , and the Winyah Bay near Georgetown and Hunting Beach State Park both offer great experiences for the nature lover .
#Text=Buy
#Text=Litchfield Books , 14427 Ocean Hwy , Litchfield Landing , Unit G , Pawleys Island , South Carolina .

#Text=Bove
#Text=High Hammock
#Text=Louis 's at Pawleys and The Fish Camp Bar , Highway 17 at the Hammock Shops .
#Text=Open Daily from 11AM till 10PM weekdays and 11PM weekends .
#Text=Owned and operated by Chef Louis Osteen , this restaurant is defined by his passionate devotion to the foods of his Southern ancestry and the Lowcountry .
#Text=The chef is widely recognized for leading the charge in the preservation of Southern cooking traditions and an early proponent of using local ingredients .
#Text=The business includes the elegant Louis 's at Pawleys , the more casual Fish Camp Bar , or at the specialty food and fine wine market - Louis 's To Go .
#Text=Palmetto Cheese , toll-free : +1-888-406-9823 .
#Text=A brand of pimento cheese that originated at the Sea View Inn on Pawleys Island .
#Text=It is still produced locally for the Pawleys Island area and can be found at Food Lion , Piggly Wiggly at Litchfield and Sea View Inn .
#Text=Sleep

#Text=Check-in : noon , check-out : 10AM .
#Text=On a private beach with the ocean on one side , and a pristine salt marsh on the other .
#Text=Charming and laid back , is smack in the middle of the island .
